intro: Schraderia, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Papaveraceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to southern Africa. These plants are characterized by their showy, cup-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The leaves are usually alternate and have a distinctive, lobed shape. Schraderia species are often cultivated for their ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses.
